intro: Spermacoce quadrifaria, commonly known as the four-leaf groundcherry, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy. Its seeds are enclosed in a spherical, ribbed fruit that splits open when mature. The species is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
